cnWords: 什么...该死...
enWords: What... damn it...

cnWords: Webb?!不...这不对...
enWords: Webb?! No... this isn't right...

cnWords: 我敲门...然后...
enWords: I knocked... then...

cnWords: 别动!举起手!
enWords: Don't move! Hands up!

cnWords: 等等...我是——
enWords: Wait... I'm—

cnWords: 闭嘴!你有权保持沉默!
enWords: Shut up! You have the right to remain silent!

cnWords: 我没有杀他!我是被——
enWords: I didn't kill him! I was—

cnWords: 被栽赃?都这么说。给我铐起来!
enWords: Framed? They all say that. Cuff him!

cnWords: 等一下!
enWords: Wait a minute!

cnWords: 滚出去!这是犯罪现场!
enWords: Get out! This is a crime scene!

cnWords: 《芝加哥先驱报》。我拍到有人从后门离开。
enWords: Chicago Herald. I photographed someone leaving through the back door.

cnWords: 你最好有证据,否则我连你一起抓!
enWords: You better have evidence, or I'll arrest you too!

cnWords: 枪响11点47分,您破门11点54分。警局到这里要十二分钟。
enWords: Gunshot at 11:47, you broke in at 11:54. Police station is twelve minutes away.

cnWords: 小姑娘,别多管闲事。
enWords: Little girl, mind your own business.

cnWords: 我只是记录事实。您要是现在抓人,明天《先驱报》头版就是:警方草率定案。
enWords: I'm just recording facts. If you arrest him now, tomorrow's Herald front page: Police rush to judgment.

cnWords: 听着,Brennan。72小时。找不到真凶,我让你在监狱里烂掉。
enWords: Listen, Brennan. 72 hours. Can't find the real killer, I'll let you rot in prison.

cnWords: 还有你。妨碍司法,够你受的。
enWords: And you. Obstruction of justice, that's enough for you.

cnWords: 你还好吗?
enWords: Are you okay?

cnWords: 谢了。
enWords: Thanks.

cnWords: 你到底拍到什么了?
enWords: What did you actually photograph?

cnWords: 一个模糊的背影。不够当证据,但够吓唬Morrison。
enWords: A blurry silhouette. Not enough for evidence, but enough to scare Morrison.

cnWords: 所以你在赌。
enWords: So you were gambling.

cnWords: 我们都在赌。
enWords: We're all gambling.

cnWords: 你要去哪儿?
enWords: Where are you going?

cnWords: 找出谁陷害我。
enWords: Find out who framed me.

cnWords: 一个人?72小时?
enWords: Alone? 72 hours?

cnWords: 我习惯一个人。
enWords: I'm used to being alone.

cnWords: Morrison明显有问题。他来得太快,太急于定你的罪。
enWords: Morrison obviously has issues. He came too fast, too eager to pin it on you.

cnWords: 所以?
enWords: So?

cnWords: 所以这不只是一起简单的谋杀。背后有更大的事。
enWords: So this isn't just a simple murder. There's something bigger behind it.

cnWords: 那是你的新闻。不是我的问题。
enWords: That's your news story. Not my problem.

cnWords: 我也在调查Webb。我有线索,有渠道,有——
enWords: I'm also investigating Webb. I have leads, channels, and—

cnWords: 我不需要搭档。
enWords: I don't need a partner.

cnWords: 你需要不进监狱。
enWords: You need to not go to prison.

cnWords: 听着,我知道你不信任我。我也不指望你信任我。但现在你没有选择。Morrison盯上你了,72小时根本不够。
enWords: Listen, I know you don't trust me. I don't expect you to. But you have no choice now. Morrison's after you, 72 hours isn't enough.

cnWords: ...你想要什么?
enWords: ...what do you want?

cnWords: 真相。还有一个好故事。
enWords: The truth. And a good story.

cnWords: 至少你诚实。
enWords: At least you're honest.

cnWords: 这是答应了?
enWords: So you agree?

cnWords: 我还有选择吗?
enWords: Do I have a choice?

cnWords: 那我们从哪儿开始?
enWords: So where do we start?

cnWords: 有人让我进去,有人打晕我,有人布置现场。Webb的员工都看到我来了。酒保、门童、歌女、厨师...他们都知道些什么。
enWords: Someone let me in, someone knocked me out, someone staged the scene. Webb's employees all saw me arrive. Bartender, doorman, singer, chef... they all know something.

cnWords: 好。我来问,你观察。
enWords: Good. I'll ask, you observe.

cnWords: 我说了算。
enWords: I'm in charge.

cnWords: 当然。你是专家。
enWords: Of course. You're the expert.

cnWords: Brennan先生?这么晚了还来...有什么我能帮您的吗?
enWords: Mr. Brennan? Coming so late... is there anything I can help you with?

cnWords: 我需要问你几个问题,关于昨晚的事。
enWords: I need to ask you some questions about last night.

cnWords: 昨晚...真是太不幸了。Webb先生是个...是个好老板。我在这儿工作五年了,从来没想过...会发生这种事...
enWords: Last night... such a tragedy. Mr. Webb was a... was a good boss. I've worked here for five years, never thought... this would happen...

cnWords: 你昨晚在哪儿?
enWords: Where were you last night?

cnWords: 在办公室!一直在办公室!月底了,得对账,您知道的...账目、排班、库存...这些都要我来处理...
enWords: In the office! Always in the office! End of month, had to reconcile accounts, you know... ledgers, schedules, inventory... all need my handling...

cnWords: 有人能证明吗?
enWords: Can anyone verify?

cnWords: 这个...我一个人在办公室。不过账本可以证明,您看,这些都是昨晚整理的...
enWords: Well... I was alone in the office. But the ledgers can prove it, look, these were all organized last night...

cnWords: 你听到枪声了吗?
enWords: Did you hear gunshots?

cnWords: 听到了...很响,吓了我一跳。我当时以为又是哪家的麻烦...
enWords: Heard it... very loud, startled me. I thought it was trouble from some gang...

cnWords: 几点?
enWords: What time?

cnWords: 11点半...应该是11点30分。我看了表。当时正在核对这笔账...
enWords: 11:30... should be 11:30. I checked my watch. Was verifying this account at the time...

cnWords: 这声枪响和平时的一样吗?
enWords: Was this gunshot the same as usual?

cnWords: 不太一样...平时要是有麻烦,都是一连串的枪声,很乱。但昨晚...就一声。所以我当时还以为是什么东西掉了...后来听到有人喊,才知道...
enWords: Not quite the same... usually when there's trouble, it's a series of gunshots, very chaotic. But last night... just one shot. So I thought something fell... later heard someone shouting, then I knew...

cnWords: 你是这儿的清洁工?
enWords: You're the janitor here?

cnWords: 是...是的,先生。
enWords: Yes... yes, sir.

cnWords: Zack Brennan,私家侦探。昨晚你在哪儿工作?
enWords: Zack Brennan, private detective. Where were you working last night?

cnWords: 我...我一直在地下室。酒窖那边,整理酒瓶和架子...很忙的...一直在那儿...
enWords: I... I was in the basement all the time. Wine cellar area, organizing bottles and shelves... very busy... stayed there...

cnWords: 整晚?
enWords: All night?

cnWords: 对!一直在!我什么都...什么都没看到!
enWords: Yes! All the time! I didn't... didn't see anything!

cnWords: 我还没问你看到什么。
enWords: I haven't asked what you saw yet.

cnWords: 我是说...地下室很安静,我就...就一直在干活...什么都不知道...
enWords: I mean... the basement is very quiet, I just... just kept working... don't know anything...

cnWords: 地下室能听到一楼的枪声吗?
enWords: Can you hear gunshots from the first floor in the basement?

cnWords: 听...听不到!地下室很深,我什么都没听到...
enWords: Can't... can't hear! Basement is very deep, I didn't hear anything...

cnWords: 你在撒谎。
enWords: You're lying.

cnWords: 没有!我...我真的在地下室!先生,求您了...我还有个孩子要照顾...我只是个清洁工...
enWords: No! I... I was really in the basement! Sir, please... I have a child to take care of... I'm just a janitor...

cnWords: 你孩子多大?
enWords: How old is your child?

cnWords: 八...八岁...他生病了,需要钱治病...我真的什么都不知道...
enWords: Eight... eight years old... he's sick, needs money for treatment... I really don't know anything...

cnWords: 我不是来为难你的。但如果你撒谎,我会知道。
enWords: I'm not here to make things difficult for you. But if you lie, I'll know.

cnWords: 我...我没有...
enWords: I... I didn't...

cnWords: 我会再来找你。到那时,希望你想好要说什么。
enWords: I'll come back to find you. By then, hope you've thought about what to say.

cnWords: 好的...好的,先生...我会在这儿...
enWords: Okay... okay, sir... I'll be here...

cnWords: Zack,你看这个工作记录卡。Rosa说她整晚在地下室酒窖,但记录显示她在后台走廊。
enWords: Zack, look at this work record card. Rosa said she was in the basement wine cellar all night, but the record shows she was in the backstage corridor.

cnWords: 还有这个。
enWords: And this.

cnWords: 氯仿毛巾...这不是清洁用品。走廊垃圾桶里还有氯仿瓶。
enWords: Chloroform towel... this isn't a cleaning product. There's also a chloroform bottle in the corridor trash can.

cnWords: Rosa在撒谎。她知道的比她说的多得多。
enWords: Rosa's lying. She knows much more than she's saying.

cnWords: 但是Zack...她儿子的照片,还有那些医院账单...她看起来很绝望。
enWords: But Zack... her son's photo, and those hospital bills... she looks desperate.

cnWords: 绝望的人做绝望的事。不代表她没有撒谎。
enWords: Desperate people do desperate things. Doesn't mean she's not lying.

cnWords: 我知道。只是...也许她是被逼的?
enWords: I know. It's just... maybe she was forced?

cnWords: 那我们就去问清楚。她到底在隐瞒什么,为什么要隐瞒。
enWords: Then let's go ask. What is she hiding, and why.

cnWords: 你打算怎么问?
enWords: How do you plan to ask?

cnWords: 一步步来。先击破她的地点谎言,然后看她怎么圆。
enWords: Step by step. First break her location lie, then see how she covers.

cnWords: 她可能会崩溃...
enWords: She might break down...

cnWords: 如果她真的是被迫的,崩溃反而是解脱。走吧。
enWords: If she was really forced, breaking down would be a relief. Let's go.

cnWords: Rosa,这是你的工作安排表。上面明确写着你昨晚23:00到01:00在后台走廊清洁,不是地下室酒窖。
enWords: Rosa, this is your work schedule. It clearly states you were cleaning the backstage corridor from 23:00 to 01:00 last night, not the basement wine cellar.

cnWords: 你为什么要撒谎?
enWords: Why are you lying?

cnWords: 哦...哦天哪,我...我可能记错了...最近太累了,总是搞混工作安排...
enWords: Oh... oh my god, I... I might have remembered wrong... been so tired lately, always mixing up work schedules...

cnWords: 对,我是在后台清洁...
enWords: Yes, I was cleaning backstage...

cnWords: 我在后台走廊工作,但我很专心清洁地板和墙壁,那里很安静,什么异常都没发生...
enWords: I was working in the backstage corridor, but I focused on cleaning the floor and walls, it was quiet there, nothing unusual happened...

cnWords: 专心清洁?
enWords: Focused on cleaning?

cnWords: Rosa,这条毛巾在你的工作区域被发现,上面有氯仿残留。而这个氯仿瓶是在后台走廊的垃圾桶内发现的。
enWords: Rosa, this towel was found in your work area, with chloroform residue on it. And this chloroform bottle was found in the trash can in the backstage corridor.

cnWords: 你说当时你在后台清洁,你工作区域的毛巾沾染了案发现场附近的氯仿,氯仿是医用麻醉剂,不是清洁用品。
enWords: You said you were cleaning backstage at the time, the towel from your work area is contaminated with chloroform near the crime scene, chloroform is a medical anesthetic, not a cleaning product.

cnWords: 如果你什么都没看到,怎么解释这个?
enWords: If you didn't see anything, how do you explain this?

cnWords: 好吧!是我!是我用这条毛巾迷昏了您!
enWords: Okay! It was me! I drugged you with this towel!

cnWords: 我儿子Miguel生病了,需要手术费,我实在没办法了...
enWords: My son Miguel is sick, needs surgery money, I really had no choice...

cnWords: 求求您别让我坐牢,Miguel还需要我照顾...
enWords: Please don't send me to prison, Miguel still needs my care...

cnWords: 我等您路过走廊时,从背后用毛巾捂住您的嘴和鼻子...您昏倒后我把您拖到Webb先生的办公室...
enWords: I waited for you to pass the corridor, covered your mouth and nose from behind with the towel... after you passed out I dragged you to Mr. Webb's office...

cnWords: Rosa,我相信你爱你的儿子,但你不是凶手。
enWords: Rosa, I believe you love your son, but you're not the killer.

cnWords: 看这些拖拽痕迹——需要150磅的力量才能造成2.5厘米的压痕。你体重不到120磅,根本做不到。
enWords: Look at these drag marks — it takes 150 pounds of force to create a 2.5cm indentation. You weigh less than 120 pounds, you simply can't do it.

cnWords: 谁威胁你这样说的?
enWords: Who threatened you to say this?

cnWords: 是...是Morrison警官...
enWords: It's... it's Officer Morrison...

cnWords: 他...他说如果我不配合,就让我失去工作...他知道我儿子生病的事,知道我需要这份工作...
enWords: He... he said if I don't cooperate, he'll make me lose my job... he knows about my son's illness, knows I need this job...

cnWords: 我不知道他要做什么!我只是按他说的,如果有人问起,就说什么都没看到...如果实在瞒不住,就说是我做的...
enWords: I didn't know what he was going to do! I just did what he said, if anyone asks, say I didn't see anything... if I really can't hide it, say I did it...

cnWords: 求求您别让Morrison知道我说了...我真的不知道他具体做了什么...我发誓!
enWords: Please don't let Morrison know I told... I really don't know what he specifically did... I swear!

cnWords: 选项A对应这个
enWords: it is A

cnWords: 选项B对应这个
enWords: it is B

cnWords: 选项C对应这个
enWords: it is C

cnWords: 结束
enWords: end
